speaker: PAROLLES
text_entry: ACT III

speaker: PAROLLES
text_entry: SCENE I. Florence. The DUKE's palace.

speaker: PAROLLES
text_entry: Flourish. Enter the DUKE of Florence attended; the two Frenchmen, with a troop of soldiers.

speaker: DUKE
text_entry: So that from point to point now have you heard

speaker: DUKE
text_entry: The fundamental reasons of this war,

speaker: DUKE
text_entry: Whose great decision hath much blood let forth

speaker: DUKE
text_entry: And more thirsts after.

speaker: First Lord
text_entry: Holy seems the quarrel

speaker: First Lord
text_entry: Upon your grace's part; black and fearful

speaker: First Lord
text_entry: On the opposer.

speaker: DUKE
text_entry: Therefore we marvel much our cousin France

speaker: DUKE
text_entry: Would in so just a business shut his bosom

speaker: DUKE
text_entry: Against our borrowing prayers.

speaker: Second Lord
text_entry: Good my lord,

speaker: Second Lord
text_entry: The reasons of our state I cannot yield,

speaker: Second Lord
text_entry: But like a common and an outward man,

speaker: Second Lord
text_entry: That the great figure of a council frames

speaker: Second Lord
text_entry: By self-unable motion: therefore dare not

speaker: Second Lord
text_entry: Say what I think of it, since I have found

speaker: Second Lord
text_entry: Myself in my incertain grounds to fail

speaker: Second Lord
text_entry: As often as I guess'd.

speaker: DUKE
text_entry: Be it his pleasure.

speaker: First Lord
text_entry: But I am sure the younger of our nature,

speaker: First Lord
text_entry: That surfeit on their ease, will day by day

speaker: First Lord
text_entry: Come here for physic.

speaker: DUKE
text_entry: Welcome shall they be;

speaker: DUKE
text_entry: And all the honours that can fly from us

speaker: DUKE
text_entry: Shall on them settle. You know your places well;

speaker: DUKE
text_entry: When better fall, for your avails they fell:

speaker: DUKE
text_entry: To-morrow to the field.

speaker: DUKE
text_entry: Flourish. Exeunt
